com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses

Class HILang

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.highsoft.highcharts.Common.HIChartsClasses.HILang
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HIChartsJSONSerializable

    public class HILang
extends java.lang.Object
implements HIChartsJSONSerializable
    description: Language object. The language object is global and it can't be set on each chart initiation. Instead, use Highcharts.setOptions to set it before any chart is initialized. Highcharts.setOptions({ lang: { months: [ 'Janvier', 'Février', 'Mars', 'Avril', 'Mai', 'Juin', 'Juillet', 'Août', 'Septembre', 'Octobre', 'Novembre', 'Décembre' ], weekdays: [ 'Dimanche', 'Lundi', 'Mardi', 'Mercredi', 'Jeudi', 'Vendredi', 'Samedi' ] } });

    • Field Detail

      • resetZoom

        public java.lang.String resetZoom
        description: The text for the label appearing when a chart is zoomed. default: Reset zoom

      • shortMonths

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> shortMonths
        description: An array containing the months names in abbreviated form. Corresponds to the %b format in Highcharts.dateFormat(). default: [ "Jan" , "Feb" , "Mar" , "Apr" , "May" , "Jun" , "Jul" , "Aug" , "Sep" , "Oct" , "Nov" , "Dec"]

      • numericSymbolMagnitude

        public java.lang.Number numericSymbolMagnitude
        description: The magnitude of numericSymbols replacements. Use 10000 for Japanese, Korean and various Chinese locales, which use symbols for 10^4, 10^8 and 10^12. demo: https://jsfiddle.net/gh/library/pure/highcharts/highcharts/tree/master/samples/highcharts/lang/numericsymbolmagnitude/ : 10000 magnitude for Japanese default: 1000

      • drillUpText

        public java.lang.String drillUpText
        description: The text for the button that appears when drilling down, linking back to the parent series. The parent series' name is inserted for {series.name}. default: Back to {series.name}

      • noData

        public java.lang.String noData
        description: The text to display when the chart contains no data. Requires the no-data module, see noData. default: No data to display

      • downloadPDF

        public java.lang.String downloadPDF
        description: Exporting module only. The text for the PDF download menu item. default: Download PDF document

      • contextButtonTitle

        public java.lang.String contextButtonTitle
        description: Exporting module menu. The tooltip title for the context menu holding print and export menu items. default: Chart context menu

      • shortWeekdays

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> shortWeekdays
        description: Short week days, starting Sunday. If not specified, Highcharts uses the first three letters of the lang.weekdays option. demo: https://jsfiddle.net/gh/library/pure/highcharts/highcharts/tree/master/samples/highcharts/lang/shortweekdays/ : Finnish two-letter abbreviations

      • resetZoomTitle

        public java.lang.String resetZoomTitle
        description: The tooltip title for the label appearing when a chart is zoomed. default: Reset zoom level 1:1

      • printChart

        public java.lang.String printChart
        description: Exporting module only. The text for the menu item to print the chart. default: Print chart

      • months

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> months
        description: An array containing the months names. Corresponds to the %B format in Highcharts.dateFormat(). default: [ "January" , "February" , "March" , "April" , "May" , "June" , "July" , "August" , "September" , "October" , "November" , "December"]

      • downloadSVG

        public java.lang.String downloadSVG
        description: Exporting module only. The text for the SVG download menu item. default: Download SVG vector image

      • invalidDate

        public java.lang.String invalidDate
        description: What to show in a date field for invalid dates. Defaults to an empty string.

      • downloadXLS

        public java.lang.String downloadXLS
        description: Export-data module only. The text for the menu item. default: Download XLS

      • downloadJPEG

        public java.lang.String downloadJPEG
        description: Exporting module only. The text for the JPEG download menu item. default: Download JPEG image

      • downloadPNG

        public java.lang.String downloadPNG
        description: Exporting module only. The text for the PNG download menu item. default: Download PNG image

      • numericSymbols

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> numericSymbols
        description: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metric_prefix : Metric prefixes used to shorten high numbers in axis labels. Replacing any of the positions with null causes the full number to be written. Setting numericSymbols to null disables shortening altogether. demo: https://jsfiddle.net/gh/library/pure/highcharts/highcharts/tree/master/samples/highcharts/lang/numericsymbols/ : Replacing the symbols with text default: [ "k" , "M" , "G" , "T" , "P" , "E"]

      • downloadCSV

        public java.lang.String downloadCSV
        description: Export-data module only. The text for the menu item. default: Download CSV

      • weekdays

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> weekdays
        description: An array containing the weekday names. default: ["Sunday", "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday", "Saturday"]

      • viewData

        public java.lang.String viewData
        description: Export-data module only. The text for the menu item. default: View data table

      • loading

        public java.lang.String loading
        description: The loading text that appears when the chart is set into the loading state following a call to chart.showLoading. default: Loading...

      • decimalPoint

        public java.lang.String decimalPoint
        description: The default decimal point used in the Highcharts.numberFormat method unless otherwise specified in the function arguments. default: .

      • thousandsSep

        public java.lang.String thousandsSep
        description: The default thousands separator used in the Highcharts.numberFormat method unless otherwise specified in the function arguments. Since Highcharts 4.1 it defaults to a single space character, which is compatible with ISO and works across Anglo-American and continental European languages. The default is a single space. default:
